docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson is adamant none of his World Cup squad are going to Brazil just for the ride despite including eight players under 24.
docs.lead_paragraph: England manager Roy Hodgson is adamant none of his World Cup squad are going to Brazil just for the ride despite including eight players under 24.

headline.main: The Kids Are Alright, Says England Boss Hodgson
headline.print_headline: The Kids Are Alright, Says England Boss Hodgson

docs.snippet: Italy and Juventus defender Giorgio Chiellini was banned for three matches for elbowing on Monday, leaving him in danger of being left out of his country's World Cup squad for indiscipline.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy and Juventus defender Giorgio Chiellini was banned for three matches for elbowing on Monday, leaving him in danger of being left out of his country's World Cup squad for indiscipline.

headline.main: Soccer-Chiellini World Cup Place at Risk Over Elbowing
headline.print_headline: Soccer-Chiellini World Cup Place at Risk Over Elbowing

docs.snippet: Uruguay President Jose Mujica, meeting at the White House with President Barack Obama, on Monday urged the United States to become bilingual, joking that immigrants from Latin America would fill the country with Spanish speakers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay President Jose Mujica, meeting at the White House with President Barack Obama, on Monday urged the United States to become bilingual, joking that immigrants from Latin America would fill the country with Spanish speakers.

headline.main: At White House, Uruguay President Urges U.S. to Become Bilingual
headline.print_headline: At White House, Uruguay President Urges U.S. to Become Bilingual

docs.snippet: President José Mujica’s visit to the White House came as the South American country seeks new markets for its commodities exports.
docs.lead_paragraph: President José Mujica’s visit to the White House came as the South American country seeks new markets for its commodities exports.

headline.main: Uruguayan Leader Meets With Obama to Talk Trade and Human Rights

docs.snippet: The Socceroos face an almighty challenge getting through their World Cup 'group of death' but it is not the Australian way to park the bus in the hope of scoring cheeky goals on the counter-attack, according to former Australia striker John Aloisi.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Socceroos face an almighty challenge getting through their World Cup 'group of death' but it is not the Australian way to park the bus in the hope of scoring cheeky goals on the counter-attack, according to former Australia striker John Aloisi.

headline.main: Australia Won't Park Buses in Brazil-Aloisi
headline.print_headline: Australia Won't Park Buses in Brazil-Aloisi

docs.snippet: Ghana midfielder Kwadwo Asamoah believes the Black Stars have put their disappointing exit from the 2010 World Cup firmly behind them and can draw on that experience to emerge from a tough group at next month's tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ghana midfielder Kwadwo Asamoah believes the Black Stars have put their disappointing exit from the 2010 World Cup firmly behind them and can draw on that experience to emerge from a tough group at next month's tournament.

headline.main: Asamoah Hopes 2010 Experience Can Spur Ghana On
headline.print_headline: Asamoah Hopes 2010 Experience Can Spur Ghana On

docs.snippet: The United States became the world's biggest market for wine last year, beating France into second place for the first time as consumption slides in the country long seen as its natural home and Americans develop a greater taste for it.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States became the world's biggest market for wine last year, beating France into second place for the first time as consumption slides in the country long seen as its natural home and Americans develop a greater taste for it.

headline.main: USA Becomes World Biggest Wine Market as French Drinkers Cut Down
headline.print_headline: USA Becomes World Biggest Wine Market as French Drinkers Cut Down

docs.snippet: Pessimism about England's World Cup prospects seems to have reached the highest levels after a government document suggested that the national team faced their customary early exit from the tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pessimism about England's World Cup prospects seems to have reached the highest levels after a government document suggested that the national team faced their customary early exit from the tournament.

headline.main: Government Report Pours Cold Water on England World Cup Hopes
headline.print_headline: Government Report Pours Cold Water on England World Cup Hopes

docs.snippet: A prisoner in Uruguay tapped into the U.S. ambassador's cellphone and sent messages to some of her contacts in an attempt to commit a still undisclosed fraud, authorities said Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: A prisoner in Uruguay tapped into the U.S. ambassador's cellphone and sent messages to some of her contacts in an attempt to commit a still undisclosed fraud, authorities said Tuesday.

headline.main: Uruguay: Prisoner Hacks US Ambassador's Cellphone
headline.print_headline: Uruguay: Prisoner Hacks US Ambassador's Cellphone

docs.snippet: A roundup of preliminary roster news from announcements on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: A roundup of preliminary roster news from announcements on Tuesday.
docs.abstract: Belgium announces its 30-man provisional World Cup roster, including youngsters Adnan Januzaj and Divock Origi, who have never before made an international appearance; other soccer news noted.

headline.main: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 30
